snippet: Owners of for-hire vehicles sued the city, saying use of the apps would violate a ban on prearranged rides in yellow taxis and upend their business model.
abstract: State Supreme Court Justice Carol E Huff blocks New York City's plans to allow taxi riders to hail yellow cabs using smartphone apps; owners of for-hire vehicles argue the city's plans violate a longstanding ban on prearranged rides in yellow taxis and would upend their business model.
lead_paragraph: Owners of for-hire vehicles sued the city, saying use of the apps would violate a ban on prearranged rides in yellow taxis and upend their business model.

headline.seo: Judge Temporarily Blocks Use of Smartphone Apps to Hail Yellow Cabs
headline.main: Judge Temporarily Blocks Cab-Hailing by Smartphones
headline.print_headline: Judge Temporarily Blocks Cab-Hailing by Smartphones
